result.execSummary:
The defendant Keona K McLeod was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Manuf/Deliver Schedule I, II Narcotics [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Maintain Drug Trafficking Place [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.42(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Pay costs on each count of the action. Pay supervision fees as ordered by Dept. of Corrections. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Maintain absolute sobriety from alcohol. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. No contact direct or indirect with Amy or Deb Cravillion.
Complete any counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate resulting from the Department's COMPAS assessment.

of Plea and Sentencing Hearing held 4/16/15
Door/Kewaunee Drug Task Force Expense sheets

Defendant Keona K McLeod in court with attorney Peter Raymond Heyne. Defendant Keona K McLeod in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters no contest pleas to Counts 1, 4, 6, 7, 8. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds pleas made freely and voluntarily, accepts pleas, and finds Defendant guilty of Counts 1, 4, 6, 7, 8. Defense stipulates to convictions for repeater/second and subsequent allegations. Court questions Defendant, who agrees. Court reviews collateral consequences of felony conviction, possible penalties. Counts 2, 3, 5 are dismissed but read in for sentencing. State/Defense make sentencing recommendations. Bond no longer in effect.
Defense waives reading of Information, enters not guilty pleas. Defense advises of potential global resolution, requests hearing a couple weeks. Plea hearing scheduled for April 16, 2015 at 2:30.

Defendant Keona K McLeod in court with attorney Peter Raymond Heyne. Defendant Keona K McLeod in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense advises that Defendant will waive prelim. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds Defendant over for trial.

Defendant Keona K McLeod in court with along with attorney Peter Raymond Heyne who appears by phone.  Defendant Keona K McLeod in custody.  Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions counsel on where matter is at.  Atty Heyne has reviewed all charges and penalties with defendant, anticipates waiver of prelim in felony files. Atty Heyne requests waiver of prelim hearing on March 30 when he'll be in Door County on another matter. Bond remains in effect.  Waiver of Prelim scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 11:30 am.
by Defendant
from Atty Heyne requesting to appear by phone for 3/20/15 hearing. Court grants request.

Defendant Keona K Mcleod in court, in custody. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion regarding expectation that Atty Heyne is taking over all pending cases.  Status conference scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 01:45 pm.
Defendant was fingerprinted.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then only take in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. To be fingerprinted and photographed before leaving Justice Center.

Defendant Keona K Mcleod in court with attorney Gregory A. Gerbers. Defendant Keona K Mcleod in custody. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews charges, max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim. Bond set. Defense advises that Atty Heyne will be appointed. Court advises that if prelim is to be held, will have to be 3/10 or before Judge Ehlers.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 10:00 am.
